Amazon AWS Sig V4 Burp Plugin

10 Dec 2013 - Mike Warner

Amazon AWS Sig V4 Burp Plugin

Testing Amazon Web Service APIs can be a frustrating experience for any security researcher; each AWS web request is digitally signed with Amazonâ€™s publicly documented signing algorithm, making tampering with requests rather painful. This signing algorithm has been implemented as a Burp Proxy plugin making it easy to modify requests. Now any signed HTTP header and POST message can be modified without the need to manually calculate the signature, allowing time to be spent on testing rather than re-implementing a signing algorithm.

Benefits

  • Each request is tested to determine if the signature is needed or not
  • Change AWS credentials without having to reload the plugin

The Burp Plugin is hosted on GitHub.
